subject: Technology
title: Clock Speed and Gigahertz
description: A quick, practical guide to Clock Speed and Gigahertz.

hook.text: Every CPU has a clock inside. Not to tell time, but to keep billions of operations in sync.

buildup.text: Each tick of the clock triggers one cycle of work. More ticks per second means more work done.

discovery.text: One gigahertz means one billion ticks per second. Most modern CPUs run at 3 to 5 gigahertz.

twist.text: Faster clocks generate more heat. That's why your laptop has a fan or gets warm on your lap.

climax.text: Engineers hit a speed wall around 5 GHz. Now they add more cores instead of faster clocks.

punchline.text: Computers stopped getting faster. They started doing more at once.

quiz.question: What does one gigahertz mean?
options: One billion clock ticks per second
